page.title: 07 Farming nowadays
page.content: The area in this D-Block covers Banks, Tarleton Moss, and Hundred End. This area is mostly farm land. It is known as the "Growing Heart of Lancashire", and contains some of the best moss land available anywhere. There are plenty of glasshouses in this area, ranging from small 1/4 acre plots up to a block of 22 acres owned by L.O Jeffs. The main glasshouse crops grown are winter lettuce and early tomatoes, which both require heat, cold house lettuce, celery, cucumbers, and an experiment with indoor spinach. Outdoor crops are mostly salad crops, which include radish, curly lettuce, celery, and spring onions. Also grown extensively are root vegetables, eg. carrots, potatoes, cabbage, cauliflower, beetroot, and onions.
